Course Description: A REVIEW OF ACG 2021 AND PREPARATION FOR ACG 4101. THE COURSE EXPLORES THE PREPARATION AND USE OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION. A THOROUGH REVIEW OF MATH PROCEDURES APPLIED TO BUSINESS DECISIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
TO PROVIDE THE STUDENT WITH A SOLID KNOWLEDGE OF THE UNDERLYING CONCEPTS, AS WELL AS THE PREPARATION AND USE OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION. MORE SPECIFICALLY, THE OBJECTIVES ARE:
A.REVIEW OF ACG 2021, FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES OR EQUIVALENT COURSE.
B.A THOROUGH REVIEW OF MATH PROCEDURES APPLIED TO BUSINESS DECISIONS.
C.TO ENHANCE STUDENTS PREPARATION FOR ACG 4101, FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING I (INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING).
Textbook(s):
PRACTICAL BUSINESS MATH PROCEDURES, JEFFREY SLATER, SEVENTH EDITION, IRWIN, 2002 (WEEKS 1-3)

FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, WEYGANDT, KIESO, AND KIMMEL, FOURTH EDITION, WILEY, 2003 (WEEKS 4-14)
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
